items.title: New year may pinch as manufacturers pass on rising costs
items.summary:
- Indian automakers and appliance makers plan price hikes from January 2026 due to higher input costs and forex pressure (auto up to 3%, appliances up to 10%).
- Specific moves include JSW MG Motor India up to 2%, BMW Motorrad India up to 6%, Mercedes-Benz India up to 2%, and Ather Energy up to ₹3,000; Tata Motors, Mahindra & Mahindra, Hyundai and Kia are eyed for further hikes.
- Cost drivers include higher copper, aluminium and precious metals; rupee near ₹90/$; energy-rating changes could lift production costs; a second round in April is possible if costs stay elevated.

items.title: L&T wins ₹5,000–10,000 crore order from BPCL for its hydrocarbon business
items.summary:
- L&T's Hydrocarbon Onshore unit won a major EPCC order from BPCL for a polyethylene project at Bina, MP, valued ₹5,000–₹10,000 crore.
- Scope: LLDPE/HDPE swing unit with two trains of 575 ktpa; lump-sum turnkey delivery as part of BPCL's Bina Petrochemicals and Refinery Expansion.
- Significance: boosts domestic polymer capacity, supports Atmanirbhar Bharat, and strengthens L&T's downstream EPC credentials.

Italy fines Apple nearly 100m euros over app privacy feature
items.summary:
- Italy's AGCM fined Apple €98 million for abusing a dominant mobile app market position and privacy rule violations affecting third‑party developers via the App Store.
- The investigation says App Tracking Transparency rules are unilateral and restrictive, harming partners by constraining third‑party app distribution and data use.
- ATT requires user consent to track across apps; if declined, apps lose data for ad targeting; critics say it benefits Apple and curtails rivals.

items.title: India’s bare PCB manufacturing set for 45% CAGR surge
items.summary:
- Policy levers (anti-dumping duties, PLI, state incentives) could cover ~55–60% of capex, enabling ~18–20% ROCE; ECMS targets $12B output and 17k jobs.
- Bare PCBs ~ $5B with 88% import dependence; domestic output to $3.8B by FY29, imports to 69%; electronics output to $450B by FY30, imports 40%.
- ML/flex PCBs drive demand; 70M sqm by FY29; EMS ~30% by FY30; Amber, Kaynes, Syrma SGS capex; shift to sub-assemblies and components.

items.title: AI data boom in Mexico fuels rise in dirty energy
items.summary:
- Mexico's data-center boom, led by Microsoft, Google and Amazon, could reach ~1.5 GW by 2030, stressing an underdeveloped grid and local pollution as renewables lag.
- Despite pledges, many sites rely on fossil fuels or gas generators; CloudHQ's $4.8B plan for a 900 MW data complex illustrates scale.
- Globally, data centers still rely on fossil fuels (~56%) vs renewables (~27%), and Mexico's environmental-impact exemptions hinder emissions transparency.

items.title: Starlink in crosshairs: How Russia could attack Elon Musk's conquering of space
items.summary:
- Russia is allegedly developing a "zone-effect" anti-satellite weapon to flood Starlink orbits with pellets, risking debris and space chaos.
- Some reports describe millimeter pellets that could damage satellites while evading detection, though officials say deployability is unclear.
- Starlink's role for Ukraine makes it a Moscow target, raising attribution and debris risks for other low-Earth-orbit assets.

items.title: AI spending spree drives global tech debt issuance to record high
items.summary: - Global AI-driven debt issuance hit a record as $428.3B of tech bonds were issued in 2025 through early December, led by U.S. borrowers.\n- Leverage rose and cash-flow coverage weakened for many firms, though the largest techs remain profitable with substantial cash buffers; debt/EBITDA rose and cash-flow ratios fell.\n- Analysts caution the surge may be an overheated, potentially non-permanent shift, with wider credit spreads signaling rising market caution for hyperscalers.

items.title: Ambuja Cements board okays ACC, Orient Cement merger
items.summary: - Ambuja Cements approves merger of ACC and Orient Cement under Ambuja, subject to regulators and shareholders.\n- Benefits include better manufacturing/logistics, streamlined structure, and potential margin gain of ₹100+ per tonne.\n- Post-merge, Ambuja, ACC and Orient keep their brands with capacity expansion to 155 MTPA by FY28.

items.title: Budget 2026 likely to introduce incentive-based manufacturing support for drone sector
items.summary:
- Proposal of two-tier drone manufacturing incentive framework in Budget 2026
- Up to 10-15% capex subsidy + 10-15% output-linked subsidy with 50-60% domestic content; ~₹10,000 crore over five years
- Builds on PLI, aims at localisation, R&D, MSME participation; late entrants get tapering benefits; finance ministry in-principle clearance

Adani Group eyes nuclear power as it scales up AI data centre business in India
items.summary:
- Adani targets 1+ GW AI data centres across Visakhapatnam, Navi Mumbai, Noida and Hyderabad, backed by its renewables portfolio to power rapid scaling.
- It could own/operate nukes via partners, using the SHANTI Bill for private nuclear participation, as India aims to raise capacity to 100 GW by 2047.
- If successful, hyperscalers could add about 10 GW of data centre capacity in five years, driving ~50 GW of renewables demand and accelerating the digital-energy transition.

items.title: India concludes FTA talks with New Zealand, cuts tariffs on 95% Kiwi goods
items.summary: - New Zealand and India have concluded a free trade agreement to deepen economic ties, cutting or eliminating tariffs on about 95% of NZ exports to India, with many products duty-free from day one. - The pact could lift NZ exports to India by roughly NZ$1.1–1.3 billion per year over the next two decades, supporting jobs and higher wages in New Zealand. - Indian PM Narendra Modi and NZ PM Christopher Luxon emphasized India's large market (1.4 billion consumers) and the deal's role in strengthening bilateral friendship and economic collaboration.

India's exports rebound in Nov on supply-chain shifts, US holiday restocking : GTRI
items.summary:
- Nov exports rebounded thanks to supply-chain realignments and pre-US holiday restocking, with US imports from India up 38.29% y/y to $5.25B.
- The rebound spans about 85% of categories but is fragile, reflecting tariff-adjustment coping strategies amid ongoing tariff uncertainty.
- Key contributing sectors include electronics, gems & jewellery, machinery, pharmaceuticals, textiles, and related product groups.

items.title: Samsung Biologics to buy US drug production facility from GSK for $280 million
items.summary:
- Samsung Biologics to acquire Human Genome Sciences from GSK for $280 million to gain its first U.S. drug-manufacturing facility in Rockville, Maryland with about 60,000 L capacity. 
- The deal via Samsung Biologics America is expected to close around end-March 2026 and may involve closing-date value adjustments. 
- Separately, a U.S.–South Korea tariff accord caps pharma imports at 15% (generic drugs tariff-free) as players like Celltrion consider U.S. production moves.

items.title: Varun Beverages to acquire South African beverage firm Twizza at enterprise value of ₹1,118.7cr
items.summary:
- Varun Beverages will acquire Twizza via BevCo; Twizza becomes a step-down subsidiary; EV of ZAR 2,095 million to be paid in cash for 100% of shares.
- Twizza operates three SA plants with 100m cases/yr capacity and posted ZAR 1,689m turnover (year ended 31 Mar 2025); completion subject to approvals by 30 Jun 2026.
- The deal follows VBL’s BevCo consolidation in SA and expansion moves in Africa; VBL is PepsiCo’s large franchisee outside the USA.

items.title: Indigenous startup Digantara ventures into tracking missiles from space
items.summary:
- Digantara expands from debris/traffic monitoring to missile tracking from space, leveraging SCOT and 15 more satellites planned for 2026–27, plus two Albatross sats for early warning. 
- Skygate ground sensors and the AIRA platform will integrate space and ground data for near-real-time threat acquisition across key theatres. 
- It has raised $50 million, is expanding in the US with a Colorado Springs office, and pursuing Singapore, Thailand and Australia, with US entry requiring a dedicated local team.

items.title: President Droupadi Murmu gives assent to SHANTI Bill, paving way for private entry into nuclear power
items.summary:
- SHANTI consolidates civil-nuclear laws, repeals the Atomic Energy Act, 1962 and the Civil Liability for Nuclear Damage Act, 2010.
- It opens the sector to private participation to build, own, operate, and decommission nuclear plants under licensing and regulation.
- Strategic activities like mining, enrichment, reprocessing, waste management and heavy water production stay with the Centre or government-owned entities.
keywords: Civil Liability for Nuclear Damage Act

items.title: Adani Group eyes aircraft engine MRO and freight in next phase of aviation expansion
items.summary:
- Adani expands pilot training after buying 72.8% stake in Flight Simulation Technique Centre; simulators rise to ~45–50 in 2–3 years.
- Aviation split into airport infra and aircraft services; merging Indamer Technics with Air Works to create a cross‑civilian/defence MRO; bases Ahmedabad, Guwahati, Bhubaneswar; capabilities include landing gear, paint, P2F, engines.
- Plans ₹1 lakh crore in airports over 5 years; domestic demand to grow 10–15% over 10–15 years; ~1,700 aircraft and ~30,000 pilots needed.

items.title: Foxconn hires 30,000 staff at new, women-led unit
items.summary: - Foxconn has staffed about 30,000 for a new iPhone assembly unit in Devanahalli, Bengaluru, with peak capacity around 50,000 next year. - Around 80% of the workforce are young women (19–24), housed in dormitories with pay ~₹18,000/month plus housing and meals. - The project marks a milestone in India’s manufacturing push, aligned with Apple’s PLI scheme and a growing local supplier ecosystem, with a large export component.

India adds 50GW RE capacity with ₹2 lakh cr investment in 2025; to keep momentum in 2026
items.summary:
- India plans 50 GW of RE by 2025 with ₹2 lakh crore, aiming to sustain momentum into 2026.
- Hitachi Energy's N. Venu calls for stronger transmission, faster renewable-zone development, energy storage, and programme-based rollout.
- If executed well, grid upgrades could boost energy security, reduce costs, and attract more investment.

items.title: Chile regulator approves Codelco-SQM lithium deal hours after announcing audit
items.summary:
- Chile's regulator approved the Codelco-SQM lithium venture in Atacama, but with guidelines amid an unprecedented Comptroller audit.
- The audit proceeds despite prior rulings, aiming for transparency while the deal's structure keeps Codelco above 50%.
- The accord advances Boric's plan for greater state control of lithium, fueling questions about direct negotiations, bidding, and SQM's role.

Parliamentary panel suggests funding boost for state-owned IREL to prioritise rare earth mining
items.summary:
- Parliamentary panel urges targeted budgetary support to IREL to prioritise exploration and mining of Rare Earth Elements (REEs) to reduce import dependence.
- Recommendations call for domestic availability strategies, tech transfer via international collaborations, and strengthening the IREL value chain with expanded processing capacity.
- GSI is accelerating REE exploration (186 projects in 3 years; 94 ongoing) while IREL runs plants in Chatrapur, Aluva and Kollam to boost output and R&D for a stronger REE sector.

items.title: Titagarh Rail Systems rolls out first driverless trainset for Ahmedabad Metro Phase 2
items.summary:
- Titagarh rolled out the first driverless trainset for Ahmedabad Metro Phase 2 at its Uttarpara facility, using a Train Control and Management System for unattended operation.
- The trainset has 70-75% local content and serves a 28.26 km elevated corridor (Yellow Line 23.8 km and Violet Line branch) with 22 stations.
- CM Bhupendrabhai Patel highlighted Make in India/Atmanirbhar Bharat and indigenous design as Gujarat's metro network expands beyond 1,000 km.
